column4: is there a chat room for newbies that aren't geeks who just need some help? lol
wish I could slow this down. I'm in my 60's lol. Very happy to be using open source, just need some help getting firefox to work with reasonable speed again
do you have another browser installed that you can compare speed with?

there are several possible reasons that it would act slow, one thing you might do is disable ipv6 - a good thing to do no matter what: enter about:config in the address bar, hit enter. click through the warning message and find the following, change yours as needed: network.dns.disableIPv6;true
you will have to restart FF for the change to take effect
what chat client are you using?
you might consider opneing up a blank document in gedit, then you can cut and paste items of interese for further review...
did you get the ipv6 disabled?

there are several possible reasons that it would act slow, one thing you might do is disable ipv6 - a good thing to do no matter what: enter about:config in the address bar, hit enter. click through the warning message and find the following, change yours as needed: network.dns.disableIPv6;true
look for the entry I posted, about 4 fifths of the way down
That may not entirely solve your issue, but it can't hurt!
ipv6 is a good thing, but it has been *very* slow to be adopted, so disable for now is best for performance, unless you really need it.
there is a google E installer, you'll have to download the binary, and follow the installer instructions.
It's still IP, but has been extended to allow for more address space, and for automatic routing config, and so on...you can read up on it on Google...now!
Despite what *some* folks here say, we do try our best to help...
